newsitem.title: USA: Latshaw directors propose 20-for-one stock split.
newsitem.headline: Latshaw directors propose 20-for-one stock split.

text.p: Latshaw Enterprises Inc said Tuesday its directors had proposed a 20-for-one split of its new Class A common shares, subject to stockholder approval at a meeting to be held April 19.
The split would increase the number of Class A shares available for trading to 400,000, depending on the conversion by holders of the company's convertible debentures.
Latshaw shareholders, at the December 14 annual meeting, approved a reverse split of Latshaw common stock. As a result, each 50 shares of common were converted into one share of Class A.
Latshaw had about 10,340 shares outstanding after the reverse split.
Latshaw makes controls for regulating hydraulically and mechanically powered truck and off-road equipment and small gas-powered engines. It also makes custom injection molded plastic products.
